sentences.text: The quarterly meeting is scheduled to begin at 2 p.m.
sentences.translation_ko: 분기 회의는 오후 2시에 시작될 예정입니다.
sentences.cloze: The quarterly meeting is scheduled to ______ at 2 p.m.
sentences.explanation: After 'be scheduled to', use the base verb.

sentences.text: Due to heavy traffic, the delivery arrived two hours late.
sentences.translation_ko: 교통 체증으로 인해 배송이 두 시간 늦게 도착했습니다.
sentences.cloze: Due ______ heavy traffic, the delivery arrived two hours late.
sentences.explanation: 'Due to' must be followed by a noun phrase.

sentences.text: The manager requested that all employees submit their reports by Friday.
sentences.translation_ko: 관리자는 모든 직원에게 금요일까지 보고서를 제출하라고 요청했습니다.
sentences.cloze: The manager requested that all employees ______ their reports by Friday.
sentences.explanation: In subjunctive, use base verb after 'requested that'.

sentences.text: We will offer a discount to customers who purchase more than ten units.
sentences.translation_ko: 열 개 이상 구매하는 고객에게 할인해 드립니다.
sentences.cloze: We will offer a discount to customers ______ purchase more than ten units.
sentences.explanation: Use 'who' for people as subject of the relative clause.

sentences.text: Please avoid using personal devices in the laboratory.
sentences.translation_ko: 연구실에서는 개인 기기 사용을 피해 주세요.
sentences.cloze: Please avoid ______ personal devices in the laboratory.
sentences.explanation: After 'avoid', use a gerund (-ing).

sentences.text: The new policy has been in effect since July.
sentences.translation_ko: 새 정책은 7월부터 시행 중입니다.
sentences.cloze: The new policy has been in effect ______ July.
sentences.explanation: Use 'since' with a specific starting time.

sentences.text: As soon as we receive the payment, we will ship your order.
sentences.translation_ko: 결제를 받는 즉시 주문을 발송하겠습니다.
sentences.cloze: As soon as we ______ the payment, we will ship your order.
sentences.explanation: Use present tense after 'as soon as' for future condition.

sentences.text: Although the seminar was informative, attendance was lower than expected.
sentences.translation_ko: 세미나는 유익했지만 참석자는 예상보다 적었습니다.
sentences.cloze: ________ the seminar was informative, attendance was lower than expected.
sentences.explanation: 'Although' introduces contrast between two clauses.

sentences.text: The report must be completed prior to the board meeting.
sentences.translation_ko: 보고서는 이사회 회의 전에 완료되어야 합니다.
sentences.cloze: The report must be completed ______ the board meeting.
sentences.explanation: Use 'prior to' as a preposition meaning 'before'.

sentences.text: Each of the candidates has submitted a resume.
sentences.translation_ko: 지원자 각자는 이력서를 제출했습니다.
sentences.cloze: Each of the candidates ______ submitted a resume.
sentences.explanation: With 'each of', use a singular verb.

sentences.text: The device is capable of operating for eight hours on a single charge.
sentences.translation_ko: 이 기기는 한 번 충전으로 8시간 동안 작동할 수 있습니다.
sentences.cloze: The device is capable of ______ for eight hours on a single charge.
sentences.explanation: After 'capable of', use a gerund.

sentences.text: Not only did the company reduce costs, but it also improved quality.
sentences.translation_ko: 회사는 비용을 절감했을 뿐만 아니라 품질도 향상시켰습니다.
sentences.cloze: Not only ______ the company reduce costs, but it also improved quality.
sentences.explanation: Inversion after 'Not only' moving auxiliary 'did' before subject.

sentences.text: The warranty is valid only if the product is installed by a licensed technician.
sentences.translation_ko: 제품이 공인 기술자에 의해 설치된 경우에만 보증이 유효합니다.
sentences.cloze: The warranty is valid only ______ the product is installed by a licensed technician.
sentences.explanation: Use 'only if' to state a necessary condition.

sentences.text: Please ensure that the package is handled with care.
sentences.translation_ko: 소포가 조심스럽게 취급되도록 해 주세요.
sentences.cloze: Please ensure ______ the package is handled with care.
sentences.explanation: Use 'that' to introduce a noun clause after 'ensure'.

sentences.text: We are looking forward to meeting you at the conference.
sentences.translation_ko: 회의에서 뵙기를 기대합니다.
sentences.cloze: We are looking forward to ______ you at the conference.
sentences.explanation: After 'look forward to', use a gerund.

sentences.text: The facility remains closed while the maintenance work is carried out.
sentences.translation_ko: 정비 작업이 진행되는 동안 시설은 계속 폐쇄됩니다.
sentences.cloze: The facility remains closed ______ the maintenance work is carried out.
sentences.explanation: 'While' connects two clauses happening at the same time.

sentences.text: Employees are required to wear badges at all times.
sentences.translation_ko: 직원들은 항상 배지를 착용해야 합니다.
sentences.cloze: Employees are ______ to wear badges at all times.
sentences.explanation: 'Be required to' + base verb expresses obligation.

sentences.pattern: for + period with present perfect progressive
sentences.text: The production line has been operating smoothly for three weeks.
sentences.translation_ko: 생산 라인은 3주 동안 순조롭게 가동되고 있습니다.
sentences.cloze: The production line has been operating smoothly ______ three weeks.
sentences.explanation: Use 'for' with a duration; 'since' with a starting point.

sentences.text: The CEO will announce whether the merger will proceed.
sentences.translation_ko: CEO는 합병이 진행될지 여부를 발표할 것입니다.
sentences.cloze: The CEO will announce ______ the merger will proceed.
sentences.explanation: Use 'whether' to present alternatives or uncertainty formally.

sentences.text: We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.
sentences.translation_ko: 이로 인해 불편을 끼쳐 드려 사과드립니다.
sentences.cloze: We apologize ______ any inconvenience this may have caused.
sentences.explanation: Use 'apologize for' + noun/gerund.

sentences.text: The training was postponed because of the storm.
sentences.translation_ko: 교육은 폭풍으로 인해 연기되었습니다.
sentences.cloze: The training was postponed ______ the storm.
sentences.explanation: 'Because of' + noun; 'because' + clause.

sentences.text: Candidates must be able to work independently.
sentences.translation_ko: 지원자는 독립적으로 일할 수 있어야 합니다.
sentences.cloze: Candidates must be able to work ______.
sentences.explanation: Use an adverb to modify 'work'.

sentences.text: The refund will be processed within five business days.
sentences.translation_ko: 환불은 영업일 기준 5일 이내에 처리됩니다.
sentences.cloze: The refund will be processed ______ five business days.
sentences.explanation: 'Within' indicates a time limit not exceeding a period.

sentences.text: Please contact customer service in case of an emergency.
sentences.translation_ko: 비상시에는 고객센터로 연락해 주세요.
sentences.cloze: Please contact customer service ______ an emergency.
sentences.explanation: Use 'in case of' + noun to describe an emergency plan.
